abs: In this paper, we are concerned with the simulation of Gaussian random fields by means of iterative stochastic algorithms, which are compared in terms of rate of convergence. A parametrized class of algorithms, which includes stochastic relaxation (Gibbs sampler), is proposed and its convergence properties are established. A suitable choice for the parameter improves the rate of convergence with respect to stochastic relaxation for special classes of covariance matrices. Some examples and numerical experiments are given.
title: Improving Stochastic Relaxation for Gussian Random Fields
